adjective.description: Of or relating to phlebotomy. Also in extended use: designating or relating to bloodsucking insects.

origin: Late 18th century; earliest use found in Nocturnal Revels. From phlebotomy + -ic. Compare Byzantine Greek ϕλεβοτομική the phlebotomic art, post-classical Latin phlebotomicus, and French phlébotomique.
